actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, S. Rept. 95-760.
Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.
Reported to House from the Committee on the Judiciary, H. Rept. 95-1653.
Measure called up by consent calendar in House.

official_title: An Act to amend chapter 315 of title 18, United States Code, to authorize payment of transportation expenses for persons released from custody pending their appearance to face criminal charges before that court, any division of that court, or any court of the United States in another Federal judicial district.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, S. Rept. 95-760) Authorizes, when justice and need so require, Federal payment of specified travel expenses and allowances of persons released from custody pending an appearance to face criminal charges before the releasing Federal judge or magistrate in any judicial district. States that such provision shall take effect on October 1, 1978.

titles.title: A bill to amend chapter 315 of title 18, United States Code, to authorize payment of transportation expenses by United States marshals for transportation expenses for persons released from custody pending their appearance to face criminal charges before that court or any court of the United States in another Federal judicial district.

An Act to amend chapter 315 of title 18, United States Code, to authorize payment of transportation expenses for persons released from custody pending their appearance to face criminal charges before that court, any division of that court, or any court of the United States in another Federal judicial district.
